intro: Matayba venezuelana, commonly known as the Venezuelan matayba, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, large ovate leaves, and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
